name: The Victoria Inn

reviews.title: Great B&B and restaurant
reviews.text: The Victoria Inn is comfortable and very clean. We had a large room and en-suite which was very good value for money, though it will need a bit of TLC soon. What makes this Inn special is the great service - great hosts and our waitress at dinner was so attentive and helpful. The food is excellent - especially the dinner in the restaurant - we have been to lots of restaurants/B&Bs in the USA and it's rare to find food that seems fresh with a choice of vegetables - ie hasn't been cooked and heated up. I would certainly visit this Inn again and locals should try the restaurant, they are missing a treat.
Ann and John Rooke

reviews.text: The Victoria Inn is truly one of the last "full service" inns in New England. From the moment you walk into it's beautiful and tastefully decorated foyer, you realize you are in for a treat. The inn keepers, Stacey & Kamil, are wonderful and it quickly becomes evident that this inn is their avocation. Every detail is looked after.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided last minute to go skiing at Sunday River and were lucky enough to find one room left at The Victoria Inn for the weekend. It was great to be allowed to check in at 2pm after a cold day on the mountain. After being warmly greeted by Stacey, we were escorted to Room 9 which had more than ample room for one couple. Queen bedroom, sitting area, and bathroom downstairs with a 3 bed loft upstairs. (Great set up for a family) The room was decorated nicely and was well cleaned. Bed was perfect - not too hard or soft and the linens were good. I enjoyed a nice soak in the soaking tub after a hard day skiing and had plenty of hot water and towels. The room needed a little TLC in areas and was a littled dated from the 80s but a minor point. We slept well and the Inn was quiet at night - no banging doors or late night party owls. (i.e Sunday River)
reviews.title: Last Minute Getaway - Great Little Find

likes.liked: — good sized room, shower/tub, good hostess, GREAT CHEF

reviews.text: Due to the freezing temp, we decided to stay put and try the Inn for dinner. We were pleasantly surprised! Our dinner was amazing – he had the lamb, I had the duck. You could tell the ingredients were fresh and prepared with skill and with a passion for cooking. However, the extremely slow service took away from the outstanding meal. At times we were forgotten with empty glasses and our main course took almost 30+ mins to arrive with no one checking on us. (Other tables around us had an attentive server) But we still enjoyed not having to drive home after a great day and meal. Breakfast the next morning, included with lodging, was delicious and service was fast. You could again tell – the chef pays attention to detail and uses fresh ingredients.
reviews.title: Wonderful, warm inn
A lovely experience
reviews.text: Compared to the rates and quality of lodging options at Sunday River and other establishments in the area, we were very satisfied with our stay here. We even got a discount for a last minute reservation and 10% off dinner in the restaurant. Look forward to our next stay at the Victoria Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the inn the day before arriving, knowing nothing about the area or the inn itself. We were so pleased with it that we decided to stay an extra night. As others have noted, the inn's greatest asset is Stacey, who is so genuinely warm and friendly. We were on a budget and thus booked a standard room. Be aware that while quite lovely, they are indeed standard - pretty small, with few extras - but the price is fair. The owners have obviously put great care into the place, including personal touches like books for browsing and a large binder full of numerous recommendations on hikes, bike routes, driving routes, local restaurants, etc., that they themselves composed. The inn location is also great, situated on the main street with several shops and restaurants in walking distance, although the town itself is rather sleepy. Due to our budget, we elected to have dinner elsewhere (the menu is a tad pricey) but the breakfasts were wonderful. Of a modest portion, they were rich and filling, and above all delicious. All in all, I'd highly recommend the inn to anyone, and I hope to come back some day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Victoria Inn while on a leaf peeping trip in October. We had never stayed in a B&B before. I'm glad we picked the Victoria Inn for our first experience. The Inn was picturesque and the room was like something out of a victorian era novel. Stacy the owner made us feel right at home and was very helpful in planning our sightseeing in the area. The dinner in the restaurant was so delicious we ate there every night. The breakfast were wonderful, too. The ambience of the B&B really topped off our leaf peeping trip. I'd recommend this inn to anyone looking for a picturesque, well-maintained, and reasonably priced getaway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Victoria Inn worked out perfectly for our trip to Maine to view the fall colors. It is in a lovely small town, near the White Mountains but not in the main tourist areas. We often stay at B&Bs when traveling in Europe, and what makes a B&B stand out is often the owner. Stacey is a natural at this, she obviously enjoys running the Inn and restaurant, and warmly treats each guest as an individual. The food was very good. The breakfast was light but very good, we had the shirred eggs (baked and creamy) and also the granola (one of the best I've had), the iced pumpkin cookies upon our arrival were delicious. We were able to have dinner only one night - I had the Osso Bucco - it was really, really good. The restaurant was busy at lunch and dinner - so has a good reputation in the local community. Our room was lovely - everything looks new, it was comfortable and CLEAN!
reviews.title: really nice

description: Beautiful Victorian inn at the foothills of White Mountains in Western Maine. Only 6 miles from Sunday River Ski Resort and Golf Club. 14 Guest rooms, all with private baths, many with Jacuzzi tubs. Full breakfast is included with every room. Fine Dining in our 45 seat restaurant.
